title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 8189.17 - Maintenance of tax maps certification
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 8189.17 - Maintenance of tax maps certification

State Regulations
(a) The county director shall be responsible
for the maintenance of tax maps in current condition for each city and town
located within the county and shall make such changes to the maps from year to
year as may be necessary. The county director shall divide a lot or shall
combine lots under common ownership, at the request of the assessor, provided
such action is consistent with applicable laws and rules. (b) The county director or the assessor where
the assessor is responsible for the maintenance of tax maps shall annually
certify to ORPTS that: (1)
the supporting
information has been provided to each assessor in accordance with section
8189.14
(c) of this Part; and
(2)
the approved
tax map and copies have all been filed in accordance with section
8189.16
(b) of this Part. (c) The
annual certifications shall be in a form prescribed by ORPTS. The certification
that the requirements of section
8189.14
(c) of this Part, pertaining to supporting information, and section
8189.16
(b) of this Part, pertaining to the filing of new section maps or changes with the
city, town and village, have been satisfied shall be made no more than 30 days
after the filing of the final assessment roll. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
8189.17

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
